function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inability to detect statistically significant relationships between built environment measures and COVID-19 infection and mortality rates due to fluid and rapidly evolving nature of COVID-19 data.","Impact":"Inability to implement targeted interventions and measures to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 in the built environment, leading to increased infection and mortality rates.","Mitigation":"Utilize real-time data analysis and adaptive modeling techniques to account for the rapidly evolving nature of COVID-19 data, and integrate dynamic risk assessment protocols for built environment measures.","Technologies":"Real-time data analytics, adaptive modeling software, dynamic risk assessment tools.","People":"Public health officials, urban planners, policymakers, researchers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, government authorities."},{"Description":"Lack of consideration for the connections between community design, sustainability, and public health, leading to inadequate infecction and chronic disease management strategies.","Impact":"Increased risk of infectious and chronic diseases due to a lack of holistic understanding of the connections between community design, sustainability, and public health.","Mitigation":"Develop a sustainable and healthy environment framework that integrates infectious and chronic disease management strategies, and promotes collaborative efforts between public health, urban planning, and sustainability initiatives.","Technologies":"Integrated data platforms, interdisciplinary collaboration tools, sustainable design frameworks.","People":"Urban planners, public health professionals, sustainability advocates, policymakers.","Owner":"Collaborative initiatives between urban planning, public health, and sustainability organizations."},{"Description":"Influence of physical environment on behavior and exposures leading to increased risk of disease transmission and chronic conditions.","Impact":"Elevated risk of disease transmission and chronic conditions due to environmental factors that shape behavior and exposure.","Mitigation":"Implement policies and interventions that promote healthy activity patterns, improve access to essential services, enhance greenspace, and create supportive pedestrian environments.","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, urban design simulations, health behavior tracking systems.","People":"Urban residents, public health advocates, policymakers, community leaders.","Owner":"Local government, urban planning authorities, public health organizations."}]}
